p: Mosquito species in the forested environment ( Æ. ægypti and Culex sp.2) (Figs 11 and 14) had high annual infection rates. On the other hand, mosquitos in the residential area ( Æ. ægypti and Culex sp.2) and in the floodplain ( Æ. mcintoshi and Culex sp.1) have low infection rates (Figs 9, 10, 12 and 13) with peak rates occurring only during or immediately after an El Niño event and subsequent RVF epidemics in the East African region [ 57].
